channel.title: Git on Loving life and dreams.
channel.description: Recent content in Git on Loving life and dreams.

item.title: 02-25-Add-Sync-Gitee-Action
item.description:
1. Background

You were born as a programmer and certainly know the importance of backup. Besides, in the context of the current environment, the political relations in the United States are still rather chaotic, and for the projects stored on Github, it is no longer a country of technological freedom. So it’s still necessary for our code to have a “double” backup, and then we’ll show you how to use Action on Github to synchronize the code above Github to the Gitee warehouse site in China.

item.title: GitExtensions push Github failed logging
item.description:
Problem Description

555, today experienced a “pleasure” to install the latest program!!!

When you used GitExtensisons to push the latest written article to Github, I encountered an inexplicable error that invalidated SSH KEY authentication. Here’s how it happened: Today, when you first open Git Extensions, it’s very friendly to pop up the update prompt window, and then you click the confirmation button unconsciously. When the results are updated, an error blocking as magical as the following occurs when pushing the article to Github:


FATAL ERROR: No supported authentication methods available (server sent: publickey)
fatal: Could not read from remote repository.
Please make sure you have the correct access rights
and the repository exists.

item.title: Github push failï¼šCould not resolve hostname
item.description:
Usually the most commonly used git push command suddenly can not be used (error log as follows), the brain first jumped out of the idea is: Is Github again by the wall! This has happened before and requires accelerated access by specifying hosts.

Error log returned after git push execution:

ssh: Could not resolve hostname github.com:elkan1788: nodename nor servname provided, or not known
fatal: Could not read from remote repository.
Please make sure you have the correct access rights

item.title: Git action command collection
item.description: All say good sex is not as bad as bad writing, there is nothing wrong with it. Although learning Git has been for more than a year, but sometimes the less used commands are always a moment to remember. So decided to write it into the blog, not only to share the experience, but also easy to find their own, this blog post will continue to add up. .
